host: application programs such as a Web browser program, a Web server program, an e-mail client program, or an e-mail server program
end_system: synonymous with host, application programs such as a Web browser program, a Web server program, an e-mail client program, or an e-mail server program
communication_links: helps to connect networks together, which are made up of different types of physical media, including coaxial cable, copper wire, optical fiber, and radio spectrum
packet_switches: takes a packet arriving on one of its incoming communication links and forwards that packet on one of its outgoing communication links.
transmission_rate: different links can transmit data at different rates, measured of a link measured in bits/second
packet: the grouping of segments of data packaged together
router: typically used in the network core, forwards packets to its destination
link-layer_switch: usually used in access network, transmits packets to the end of its packet_switches
route: the sequence of communication links and packet switches traversed by a packet from the sending end system to the receiving end system
